intro: Guidonia stipularis, commonly known as the Chinese flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with elongated, oval-shaped leaflets that turn yellow in autumn. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental species. Its rapid growth and showy display make it a notable addition to gardens and parks.
